intro: Zaluzania sodiroi, commonly known as the Mexican tickseed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring a sturdy, branched stem. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and pink to red petals, blooming from summer to fall. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Zaluzania sodiroi is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
